Parameter.Name: Port
Parameter.Description: Many programming blocks require that you select the ports on the EV3 Brick (A, B, C, D, 1, 2, 3, and 4) that these blocks will use. The Port Selectors are in the top right-hand corner of these blocks.

Parameter.Name: Color
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Notes: Detected color number:
0 = No Color
1 = Black
2 = Blue
3 = Green
4 = Yellow
5 = Red
6 = White
7 = Brown

Parameter.Name: Value
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Notes: The sensor data value used for a Compare mode.

Parameter.Name: Comparison
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: 0 - 5
Notes: 0: = (Equal to)
1: ≠ (Not Equal to)
2: > (Greater than)
3: ≥ (Greater than or Equal to)
4: < (Less than)
5: ≤ (Less than or Equal to)

Parameter.Name: Threshold
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: Any number
Notes: Value to compare sensor data to

Parameter.Name: Result
Parameter.Description:
Type: Logic
Notes: True/False result of a Compare mode.

Parameter.Name: CalibrateValueMin
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: 0 – 100
Notes: Light intensity for Calibrate modes

Parameter.Name: CalibrateValueMax
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: 0 – 100
Notes: Light intensity for Calibrate modes

Block.Description: The Measure - Color mode outputs the detected color number in Color.
The Measure - Reflected Light Intensity mode outputs the light intensity in Measured Value.
The Measure - Ambient Light Intensity mode outputs the light intensity in Measured Value.

In the Compare - Color mode, you can select one or more colors in the Set of Colors. The Compare Result output will be True if the detected color matches any of the selected colors. The detected color is output to Measured Value.

The Compare – Reflected Light Intensity and Compare – Ambient Light Intensity modes compare the detected light intensity to the Threshold Value using the selected Compare Type. The True/False result is output in Compare Result, and the detected light intensity is output in Measured Value.

The Compare – Reflected Light Intensity and Compare – Ambient Light Intensity modes compare the detected light intensity to the Threshold Value using the selected Compare Type. The True/False result is output in Compare Result, and the detected light intensity is output in Measured Value.
The Calibrate – Minimum mode allows you to specify the minimum light intensity in the Value input. After calibration, the Color Sensor will report this light intensity as 0 or the value specified.
The Calibrate – Maximum mode allows you to specify the maximum light intensity in the Value input. After calibration, the Color Sensor will report this light intensity as 100 or the value specified.
The Calibrate – Reset mode restores the Color Sensor calibration to its default state.
